data.title: Emmy
authors: Contributors to Eurovision Song Contest Wiki
data.meta_description: Emmy is the stage name of Armenian singer Emma Bejanyan. She began her career in 1993, which took off after the release of her single "Hayastan". data.text:
Emmy is the stage name of Armenian singer Emma Bejanyan. She began her career in 1993, which took off after the release of her single "Hayastan". She has won several awards throughout Europe and toured with folk quartet Hayer between 1994 and 2000.

She is best-known for representing her home country at the Eurovision Song Contest 2011 in Düsseldorf with the song "Boom Boom", which failed to qualify from the first semi-final, making her her home country’s first representative to miss out on a place in the final.

Post-Contest she became a judge on the third season of the national syndication of The X Factor.
